title: Using Signal Mirror for Rescue
brief: Use mirrors or reflective objects to create long-distance visual signals to aircraft.
steps: Step 1: Use a mirror or polish canteen cup, belt buckle, or similar reflective object.
Step 2: Get to the highest point in your area when signaling.
Step 3: Direct flashes in one area secure from enemy observation.
Step 4: If you can't locate aircraft, flash signal in direction of aircraft noise.
Step 5: Wear signal mirror on cord around neck with glass against body to prevent unwanted flashes.
Step 6: Follow MK-3 signal mirror instructions if available.
warnings: Don't flash rapidly - pilot may mistake for enemy fire.
Don't direct beam into aircraft cockpit for more than few seconds - may blind pilot.
Haze, fog, and mirages can make signals hard to spot.
Enemy can see mirror flashes - use discretely in combat areas.
Pilots have reported seeing mirror flashes up to 160 kilometers away under ideal conditions.
